titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 890) to prohibit waivers relating to compliance with the work requirements for the program of block grants to States for temporary assistance for needy families, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-15, by Mr. Cole.

All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived. An amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 113-3 shall be considered as adopted. All points of order against provisions in the bill, as amended, are waived.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 7.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 107.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 107, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Cole demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question on H.Res. 107 until later in the legislative day.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 233 - 195 (Roll no. 64).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 233 - 194 (Roll no. 65).

bill.summary: 3/12/2013--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 890) to prohibit waivers relating to compliance with the work requirements for the program of block grants to States for temporary assistance for needy families.
